speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about the fatigue you're experiencing? Is it constant or does it come and go?"

speaker: Doctor

speaker: Doctor
text: "Can you tell me more about when the flank pain started? Was it after the antibiotic treatment, or did it begin before you started taking the antibiotics?" And while we're on the topic of breathing, I'd like to take a listen to your lungs. Please, cough for me.

text: "Okay, I think I understand that you're experiencing a range of symptoms that are affecting your daily life. I'd like to request some medical images to help narrow down the possible causes. speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for your willingness to undergo the ultrasound. It's a non-invasive procedure, so you won't need to insert anything into your body. I'll explain everything that happens during the procedure and answer any questions you may have. Now, while we're waiting for the ultrasound results, I'd like to request some additional information from you. Can you tell me more about your medical history, particularly any previous kidney issues or conditions that may be related to your current symptoms?"

speaker: Doctor

speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for sharing that information with me. It sounds like you're experiencing some gastrointestinal symptoms, which could be related to your kidney function or other underlying issues. I'd like to request a review of your electrolyte levels to see if there are any imbalances that could be contributing to your symptoms. Can you please tell me more about your symptoms and how they've been affecting your daily life? Have you noticed any changes in your energy levels or mental clarity lately?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, yeah, I'd say my energy levels have been pretty low lately. I've been feeling really tired all the time, and I've had to cut back on my activities to try and manage my symptoms. As for my mental clarity, I've noticed that I've been having trouble concentrating and remembering things, which is really frustrating for me. I'm a retired school teacher, so I'm used to being mentally sharp, but lately, I've just been feeling really foggy and confused."

speaker: Doctor
text: "Thank you for sharing that information with me. I think I have a good idea of what might be going on with you. I'd like to request a review of your kidney function tests again, as well as your complete blood count (CBC) and electrolyte levels, to confirm my suspicions. I'm going to go ahead and make a diagnosis based on the information you've provided. Please hold on for just a moment while I review everything." "Okay, I think I have it. Your symptoms are consistent with a diagnosis of adrenal insufficiency, specifically primary adrenal insufficiency, also known as Addison's disease. This is a rare condition where the adrenal glands do not produce enough cortisol and aldosterone hormones. This can lead to a range of symptoms, including fatigue, flank pain, weight loss, and changes in blood pressure and electrolyte levels. I'd like to request a review of your medication list to see if there's anything that could be contributing to your symptoms. Can you please tell me more about your medication regimen and any supplements or vitamins you're taking?"

speaker: Patient
text: "Oh, wow, I had no idea. I've been feeling so tired and run down, I just thought it was normal aging or something. But adrenal insufficiency? That's a lot to take in. What does that mean for my treatment options? And what kind of lifestyle changes can I make to help manage my symptoms?"
